newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates end up despite surplus funds.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates end up despite surplus funds.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates closed at a higher level despite surplus funds due to a lack of borrowing interest, dealers said.

The overnight market opened firm at 18.50 percent owing to an outflow of 13.463 billion rupees in an auction of short-term federal bonds (STFBs) on Tuesday and an inflow of 6.2 billion from an STFB maturity, a dealer at Standard Chartered Bank said.
The rates later dropped to 14 percent because of a lack of borrowing interest, he said.
Deals were also finalised at 18.95 percent before the close, the dealer said. -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
